intro: Boerhavia purpurascens, commonly known as redstem sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing, sprawling annual herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, reddish stems that are often covered in fine hairs, and its small, pink to purple flowers bloom in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Boerhavia purpurascens is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of forage for livestock.
